=Class <<a_api_type | class Ocsigen_cache.Make.cache >> =
<<div class="code"|<<span name="TYPEcache"|<<span class="keyword"|class>> cache>> : <<span class="code type"|(A.key -> A.value Lwt.t) -> ?timer:float -> int -> >><<span class='code'|object>><<a_api text=".." | class Ocsigen_cache.Make.cache >><<span class='code'|end>>>><<span class='code'|new cache finder ~?timer size>> creates a cache object where <<span class='code'|finder>>
          is the function responsible for retrieving non~-cached data~, <<span class='code'|timer>>
          ~(if any~) is the life span of cached values ~(in seconds~) ~(values in the
          cache are removed after their time is up~) and <<span class='code'|size>> is the upper
          bound to the number of simultaneoulsy cached elements~.\\


          ~Whenever a value is found ~(using <<span class='code'|find>> method~)~, it~'s lifespan is set
          to <<span class='code'|timer>> ~(or not if the cache is not time bounded~)~. ~If the value was
          already cached~, it~'s lifespan is reset to <<span class='code'|timer>>~.\\


          ~Using <<span class='code'|timer>> allow one to create a cache
          bounded both in space and time~. ~It is to be noted that real lifespan
          of values is always slightly greater than <<span class='code'|timer>>~.\\
